alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:53PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Johnson County through 215 PM MDT... At 152 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Lake De Smet, or 12 miles northeast of Buffalo, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Johnson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.
